body.p: Madisonville, Kentucky, attorney. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Attended Cumberland College. Received his legal education under Judge Collins D. Bradley in 1845. Admitted to the bar in 1846. Married to Sarah E. Pary Waddill in May 1851. Married to Maria E. Pratt Waddill in April 1865. Father of Otway W. Waddill and Joseph C. Waddill. Owned three enslaved persons in Madisonville in 1860. Member of the Whig Party and Republican Party. Elder of the Hopkins County Christian Church starting in 1851. Attorney in Hopkins County from 1851 to 1855 and again from 1863 to 1867. Partner in the law firm of Earle & Waddill, with John B. Earle, in Madisonville in 1852. Sole practitioner in Madisonville in 1853 and 1856. Partner in the law firm of Arnold & Waddill, with John E. Arnold, in Madisonville in 1859.
